title: Ferrari Just Stalled -- Why the Luxury Icon's Stock Dropped Despite Strong Profits
snippet: Tariffs, soft demand, and a missed guidance bump leave investors questioning what's next for Ferrari's EV push

title: Ferrari shares dip 12% in biggest decline since 2016 listing
snippet: Ferrari shares fell more than 12% on Thursday, the biggest single-day drop since the automaker was first publicly listed on stock exchanges in New York and Milan in 2016, Reuters reports. Yet unlike some automakers,

title: Ferrari Stock is as Pricey as Its Cars. Have Investors Lost Their ... - MSN
snippet: The thing is, at $460, Ferrari stock trades like a luxury good, with a price-to-earnings multiple of more than 45! For the past 12 months, the company earned $8.81 a share.

title: Ferrari shares slump 12% in biggest drop since 2016 listing
snippet: MILAN (Reuters) -Ferrari shares fell more than 12% on Thursday, setting the stock for its biggest one-day drop since its listing nine years ago, even as the luxury sports car maker maintained its guidance, although it said it would cut back prices in the U.S..
